content.text:
## Analysis of the Main Target Image

The main target image shows two structures:

### Structure 1 (Left side):
- A stack with 4 layers
- Bottom layer: Two orange cylindrical blocks side by side (horizontally)
- Second layer: A green rectangular block placed horizontally across the cylinders
- Third layer: A red cube
- Fourth layer: A blue cube
- Top layer: An orange triangular roof

### Structure 2 (Right side):
- A building with 3 layers and a roof
- Bottom layer: A checkerboard pattern of 2x2 blocks (blue cube on left bottom, orange cube on right bottom, orange cube on left top, blue cube on right top)
- Middle layer: A green rectangular block placed horizontally
- Top layer: An orange triangular roof

## Block Selection from Dictionary

Based on the dictionary image, I'll identify the blocks needed for each structure:

### For Structure 1 (Left):
- Bottom: Two orange cylindrical blocks (index 10)
- Second layer: Green rectangular block horizontally (index 6)
- Third layer: Red cube (index 4)
- Fourth layer: Blue cube (index 1)
- Top: Orange triangular roof (index 12)

### For Structure 2 (Right):
- Bottom layer: Blue cube (index 1) - need 2
- Bottom layer: Orange cube (index 3) - need 2
- Middle layer: Green rectangular block horizontally (index 6)
- Top: Orange triangular roof (index 12)

## Assembly Order

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 10
   Step2: Move block with index 10
   Step3: Move block with index 6
   Step4: Move block with index 4
   Step5: Move block with index 1
   Step6: Move block with index 12
   Step7: Move block with index 1
   Step8: Move block with index 3
   Step9: Move block with index 1
   Step10: Move block with index 3
   Step11: Move block with index 6
   Step12: Move block with index 12
}
```

This assembly order starts with the left structure from bottom to top, then builds the right structure from bottom to top.
